section_title: Osteochondral Autograft Transplantation - Knee (Evidence: pg no: 21, L958)
names: Osteochondral autograft transplantation (Evidence: pg no: 21, L959)
Osteochondral autograft transplant (Evidence: pg no: 21, L959)
description: Osteochondral autograft transplantation to treat cartilaginous defects of the knee (Evidence: pg no: 21, L959-L967)
scope: Treatment of knee cartilage defects (Evidence: pg no: 21, L958-L967)

documentation: Size of cartilage defect is between 1.0 cm and 2.5 cm2 in total area, as documented by MRI or arthroscopy (Evidence: pg no: 21, L962-L963)

Condition involves focal, full thickness, grade III or IV isolated defect of knee involving weight bearing surface of medial or lateral femoral condyles or trochlear region (Evidence: pg no: 21, L964-L966)
Absence of kissing knee lesions (lesion must be single and involve only one side of joint) (Evidence: pg no: 21, L967)

codes.description: Osteochondral autograft(s), knee, open (eg, mosaicplasty) includes harvesting of autograft[s]) (Evidence: pg no: 24, L1058)
Arthroscopy, knee, surgical; osteochondral autograft(s) (eg, mosaicplasty) (includes harvesting of the autograft) (Evidence: pg no: 24, L1060)
